trial_identification.studytitle: The effect of N-acetylcysteine supplementation on cycling performance and adaptation to exercise in well-trained athletes
trial_identification.scientifictitle: The effect of N-acetylcysteine on cycling performance and adaptation to exercise in well-trained athletes: a double blind randomised placebo controlled trial

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Conditions of unknown or disputed aetiology (such as chronic fatigue syndrome/myalgic encephalomyelitis)

interventions.interventions: This study has two 9-day intervention periods with a 3-week washout period between each intervention. The trial involves taking 1200 mg oral tablet of n-acetyl cysteine per day in addition to the participant's usual physical training.

primaryOutcome.timepoint: pre (day 1) and post (day 9) of each experimental period

primaryOutcome.outcome: Venous blood testing to determine changes total antioxidant status (TAS), glutathione/reduced glutathione ratio (GSSG:GSH), thiobarbituric acid-reactive substances (TBARS), interlukin-6 (IL-6), nuclear factor-kB and creatine kinase.
primaryOutcome.timepoint: pre, immediately post, 2 h post and 24 h post each Cycle ergometer test

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Training diaries and the Daily Analysis of Life Demands for Athletes
secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Completed on a daily basis during the experimental period

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: High level of physical fitness Completed 10-15 h/wk physical training for at least 2 y in either cycling or triathlon
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Regular antioxidant supplementation for previous 4 wks Illness or injury which may be exacerbated through participation in the study
